comment: She was insanely unorganized. Had wrong answers on quizzes, had to always email her. She does respond quickly. Lots of busy work, have to read 10 discussion posts and respond to 2 weekly. Her deadlines aren't clear. Unfortunately gonna have to take her for internship.

Kinda a boring class im not going to lie. She herself as a professor is good for sure, the content is just so dry and boring so its hard to actually learn and have it stick with you. Overall she does well, just participate on skill sessions and study and you will be fine

Safety Training was an easy class with her. Her grading scale for all of her classes are straight to the point. As long as you turn in assignments on time, go to class, and study for exams with even just the powerpoints that she provides, you'll get an A. She also offers extra credit but you probably won't even need them.

I really enjoyed this teacher this semester. A lot of peers do not care for her because she says too much information, and a lot of it isn't on the test. You do have opportunity for extra credit continuously and the pop quizzes are at home without a camera. Attendance is mandatory, but you will also receive bonus points.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: This professor was pretty good to me but I do know a lot of my peers didn't care for her. There is a lot of unnecessary information but she goes back and tells you what you actually need. There are a lot of quizzes but they are easy and help your grade a lot. She wants to come off as mean but she really isn't.

She tells everybody that she wants to be mean rather than nice so that they are scared of her and it shows through how she talks to people,her vague instructions on assignments,and how she gives feedback. She talks down on people away from her peers.Overall,she makes things harder than they have to be causing you to be more stressed than the takes.
this should be such an easy class and she overcomplicates the work and material. attendance is mandatory for something that could be completed online. waste of time.

This course is straightforward and easy if you pay attention. She makes the lectures easy to understand and is helpful in the hands-on activities in class. Attendance is mandatory and some days for a grade but she lets you know when. This class is overall pretty easy if you show up and learn.

this is supposed to be such an easy class and she makes it way harder than it needs to be. so much extra nonsense information. if you have to get in contact with her about missing class or assignments, she is so inconsiderate and very hard to work with. avoid and take with an easier professor
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: This course was very easy as long as you went to class and participated. She is actually a very kind professor who is kind to her students and is very understanding. I would definitely take her again.
So confused why her ratings are so low. No essays for the tests. Pretty solid.

Test were confusing at first but got better when she received feedback. It was an essay for every test. Attendance wasnt mandatory but she took attendance every class- . Decent professor if you just dont miss any assignments & if you dont bs any assignments.

Ridiculous amount of work for the class it is. Seems like she just assigns massive assignments just to try and stay relevant. Avoid if possible. Textbook was only used like twice, so it's not worth buying. Assignment and discussion-heavy. Online class with 3 easy online exams.

ES3600 should be an easy class with minimal work. She gives a lot of work! Taking this 1 class is equivalent to taking 4 classes at once. Her instructions are somewhat confusing but I did end up with an A. Just don't take this class with a a lot of other classes. Took this class with 5 other classes and it was a lot of work. Textbook needed.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Theres really a lot of work for no reason. Her instructions are really confusing, but if you somehow figure it out you can get an A. Her lectures are pretty much her reading from the book so...

I've been a student at KSU for 5 years now and no teacher even comes close to how horrible Sciacchitano is. A ridiculous amount of work, super harsh grader, and doesn't even follow her own directions. Unless you want to own and manage a gym, this class is not for you. Apparently this is her first year here and hopefully her last. She ruins ES.

AVOID! She goes out of her way to make an easy class, the bane of your existence. She assigns a ridiculous amount of work, takes off points if you don't plan to work in a gym, and she doesn't even grade based on her own directions. We have classes that actually matter to focus on. I love the ES program but this woman should not be teaching AT ALL.
